alert.note: Alert for Denton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 2:02AM CDT until October 26 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Denton County. * WHEN...Until 600 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Worth, Denton, Flower Mound, Corinth, Trophy Club, Sanger, Prosper, Celina, Roanoke, Krum, Pilot Point, Argyle, Justin, Shady Shores, Aubrey, Northlake, Krugerville, Cross Roads, Haslet and Bartonville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
